Market Hill, Sudbury
CO10 2EN

  • Tel: 01787 321595

Branch updates

Sudbury Library is looking for Home Library Service volunteers.

Room & venue hire

Room and space hire at Sudbury Library →

Branch facilities

  • Accessibility information
  • Payments: cash, cheques and cards accepted
  • Parking: unavailable
  • Out-of-hours book return available
  • Which? available - ask staff for magazine or to log in
  • Also available: Sudbury Tourist Information Centre is located within the library. Find out more on the Sudbury Town Council website.

IT and printing facilities

  • Free wifi
  • Book a computer
  • Borrow a BBC micro:bit
  • Photocopying: available
  • Colour printing: available
  • Scan to email
  • Printing, photocopying & scanning charges

Regular events and activities

Children's events

Family board games and puzzles: all welcome

Sunday, 1330-1500

Craft activities: for primary school age children.

Sunday, 1100-1230

Lego club

Saturday, 1430-1600

50p per session including refreshments. Follow the week's theme or make what you want. Receive a reward for every 10 sessions attended.

Stay and play: for babies and toddlers and their parents

Thursday, 1100-1200

Chat and enjoy a drink and biscuit with other parents while your children play with our toys. Donations for tea/coffee appreciated.

Storytime: stories and rhymes for pre-school children

Thursday, 1030-1100

No session 25 July due to extreme weather conditions.

Find out more about our Bookstart sessions

Older people's events

Top Time reading group

third Tuesday of the month, 1430-1630

Top Time: events and activities for older people

Tuesday, 1430-1630

  • 13 August: Chair Yoga with Maryanne
  • 20 August: Book group
  • 27 August: Fire safety talk
  • 3 September: Creative writing
  • 10 September: Presentation, samples and Q&A from Wiltshire Farm Foods
  • 17 September: Book group
  • 24 September: Quiz

Reading groups

Saturday Book Club

second Saturday of the month, 1030-1200

The Reader: a shared reading experience

Wednesday, 1400-1530

A friendly, social, informal and relaxing session to share yours thoughts and feelings about life through reading. Stories and poems chosen by volunteers.

Top Time reading group

third Tuesday of the month, 1430-1630

Writing groups

Creative writing group

first Tuesday of the month, 1430-1600

Email sudbury.library@suffolklibraries.co.uk for more information.

IT help

1-to-1 computer taster sessions: book in advance

Wednesday, 1430-1530

1-to-1 computer taster sessions: book in advance

Thursday, 1030-1130

Learn on one of our library computers for free, or learn on your own iPad, Android tablet or laptop for £2.

1-to-1 computer taster sessions: book in advance

Friday, 1430-1530

Learn on one of our library computers for free, or learn on your own iPad, Android tablet or laptop for £2.

Arts, crafts & games

Health & wellbeing events

Hearing Advisory Service: drop in to the meeting room

third Thursday of the month, 1330-1530

For more information, call 01473 286060, email suffolkinfo@hhas.org.uk or visit The Hearing Advisory Service website.

Open space: drop in for health info and chats. All welcome.

Thursday, 1230-1430

See the latest Sudbury Open Space timetable.

St Nicolas Hospice drop-in

Monday, 1000-1200

Open session for hospice patients, carers and bereaved in the meeting room.
